questions.question: Security model controlling access based on user roles and permissions.
questions.explanation: RBAC assigns permissions to roles, then assigns users to roles for simplified management.

questions.question: Security model using attributes of users, resources, and environment for access decisions.
questions.explanation: ABAC makes dynamic access decisions based on multiple attributes and policies.

questions.question: Attack technique using precomputed hash tables to crack passwords.
questions.explanation: Rainbow tables contain precomputed hashes to quickly reverse cryptographic hash functions.

questions.question: Encryption of data at rest in database storage.
questions.explanation: TDE automatically encrypts data files and backups without application changes.

questions.question: Security control preventing data inference through statistical queries.
questions.explanation: Statistical controls prevent users from inferring individual data from aggregate queries.

questions.question: Attack where legitimate transactions are replayed to perform unauthorized actions.
questions.explanation: Replay attacks intercept and retransmit valid data to trick the system.

questions.question: Security mechanism hiding data values from unauthorized users while preserving utility.
questions.explanation: Data masking replaces sensitive data with realistic but fictional values.

questions.question: Encryption that protects data during transmission between systems.
questions.explanation: TLS encrypts data in transit to prevent eavesdropping and tampering.

questions.question: Security policy ensuring users cannot deny performing actions.
questions.explanation: Non-repudiation provides proof of actions, preventing users from denying their activities.

questions.question: Advanced SQL injection technique exploiting time delays to extract data.
questions.explanation: Blind SQL injection infers database content by observing response times or behavior changes.
